questiontext.text:
Which of these statements about Cloud computing are true?

(A) Cloud computing focuses only on scalable storage services. It includes SQL Database and Windows Azure storage.

(B) Cloud computing is an approach that enables convenient and on-demand access through the Internet to computing capabilities and resources.

(C) In cloud computing, the data for the applications that are served over the Internet reside on the servers hosted across different datacenters that are spread over multiple geographical locations.

(D) Cloud computing is an inhouse IT based management approach and reduces upfront and regular expenses.

(E) Cloud computing is defined as an integral part of the Azure Services Platform that covers different and separate application, storage, desktop environment, security, and so on.

Which of the following are types of distributed applications?

(A) Collaboration

(B) Centralized

(C) General

(D) Real-time

(E) Computational

Which of following statements about Web Services are true?

(A) Web services are switch network systems without requiring any effort for sending messages.

(B) Web services can be defined as application components.

(C) Web services use open protocols for communication.

(D) Web services are the frameworks that include WCF.

(E) Web services use HTTP and XML as a base.

Identify the correct terms that form Web service terminologies.

(A) Host

(B) SOA

(C) Consumer

(D) Contract

(E) Ethernet

Which of these statements about the features of Windows Azure architecture are true?

(A) The Windows Azure OS is the central component of the Windows Azure Services Platform.

(B) Windows Azure OS functions handle the load balancing, caching, redundancy, resource management, and life cycles of hosted services.

(C) Only one role is allowed to an application hosted in the Windows Azure OS.

(D) Back up tools allows to sync application in different datacenters.

(E) The In-Role Cache is used for one role instance for one service for the Windows Azure OS.

Which of these statements about Windows Azure Compute Emulator are true?

(A) You can package and run any application from the command-line in the Windows Azure Compute Emulator.

(B) Windows Azure Compute Emulator is a local emulator.

(C) Compute emulator allocates alternate ports if the required port is busy.

(D) To test the scalability of a service, you should keep only one running instances of a role.

(E) You can deploy more than 50 roles when deploying a service from the compute emulator.

Which of the following services are provided by Windows Azure?

(A) Virtual Lab

(B) Hardware Maintenance

(C) Websites

(D) Mobile Services

(E) Cloud Services

Which of the following data services are provided by Windows Azure?

(A) Storage

(B) Web data

(C) SQL Database

(D) HDInsight

(E) Recovered Files
Which of the following code snippets will you use to ensure that only authenticated users will be able to invoke the Get() method?

Which of the following authentication modes does Visual Studio 2013 provide for built-in authentication support?

(A) Forms Authentication

(B) Individual User Accounts

(C) Digest Authentication

(D) Windows Authentication
Which of the following methods configure additional routes of a Web API application?
Which of the following are HTTP methods?
Which of the following key HTTP request headers specifies the content type, also known as MIME type that the request expects as response?

Which of the following statements is true regarding ASP.NET Web API service hosting?

(A) Can only be hosted on a Web server.

(B) Can be hosted on a self-hosted process.

(C) Can be hosted on IIS when the service is provided as a part of a Web application.

(D) Can be hosted in a Windows Azure Worker role.

(E) Can be hosted on Visual Studio 2013 development server to make the service available over the Web.
Which of the following standards provide the interface between a Web server and an ASP.NET Web API service?
Which of the following classes does a worker role implementation class extend?
In a self-hosted Web API service, which of the following code snippets will you use to send a request to the service and retrieve the response?
Which of the following code snippets correctly uses attribute routing in an API controller?

Which of the following statements about the Entity Framework are true?

(A) The Entity Framework allows creating data-source-independent queries to implement data access.

(B) The Entity Framework is an ORM framework that ASP.NET MVC applications can use.

(C) The Entity Framework provides four approaches to manage data related to an application.

(D) The Entity Framework is an implementation of EDM.

(E) The Entity Framework enables you to write most of the data-access code.
Which of the following options in an application coordinates with Entity Framework and allows you to query and save the data in the database?

Which of the following statements are true regarding WCF data services?

(A) WCF data service uses the Entity Data Model of the Entity Framework to expose resources as related entities.

(B) WCF data service allows you to perform CRUD operations on the entities using the standard HTTP methods.

(C) WCF data service allows you to create services using the Open Data Protocol (OData).

(D) WCF data service returns results only in the XML-based Atom format.
Which method notifies the compiler that the method will contain at least one await keyword?

Which of the following methods of the .NET Framework asynchronously advances a reader to the next

record of a result set?
Which of the following classes provides a simple interface for you to perform common tasks with the database context?
Which of the following options will you use to query data from collections such as List and Array?

Which of the following transaction properties specifies that a transaction should be considered as a single unit of operation consisting of a sequence of independent operations, where all the operations complete either successfully or unsuccessfully?
Which of the following classes of the System.Transactions namespace makes a code block transactional?
Which of the following classes allows you to combine multiple operations into a single transaction that may be distributed across multiple systems?

Which of these statements about blob storage are true?


(A) Blob storage is automatically created when you create a storage service in your Windows Azure Storage account.
(B) Blob storage in Windows Azure is used for storing the structured data.
(C) The data storage in Blob Storage is persistent, which means that if servers go off or shut down all of a sudden, the data will be retrieved from the exact point when the servers where shut down.
(D) Blobs can store a large amount of data that can be in variety of forms, such as images, video, documents, and code.
(E) Blob storage can be accessed using one of the two methods; REST-ful Blob Storage API and StorageClient Library.
What is the basic intent of Queue storage?

answer.text: To retain the last known status of the table when the servers are shut down or turned off.
To keep track of all entities that are part of the table and glue them together.
To allow front-end servers to communicate with the back-end servers, which are typically the database servers.
To create end number of containers in your Windows Azure account and then use them to contain queue.

questiontext.text:
Which are the two correct types of blobs that you can essentially create?


(A) Block blobs
(B) White blobs
(C) Storage blobs
(D) Page blobs
(E) Container blobs

Identify the advantages of tables in Table storage.


(A) Each table can grow without limitations on the size.
(B) An entity’s individual properties cannot be modified. You must rewrite the entire entity.
(C) Each table can be accessed via REST API or queried using client library for ADO.NET Data Services.
(D) Each entity can be of maximum of 1 MB in size.
(E) Each table is persistent, which means that it retains the last known status of the table when the servers are shut down or turned off.
Which namespace needs to be added in order to be able to create a WCF Service?

The functionality of a WCF service is defined by ____________.

(A) Contract
(B) Binding
(C) Address
(D) Protocol
(E) Data Contract
The contract represents the ____________________ that a service exposes, and will be read by clients that need to know what it is that the service is capable of doing.
Data contract defines the ___________.

You define a service contract by building _____________.


(A) 
(B) 
(C) 
(D)

What is a Service Bus?


(A) Connects cloud applications only in private cloud environments
(B) A messaging infrastructure
(C) Connects cloud applications only in public cloud environments
(D) Connects cloud applications across both private and public cloud environments
(E) A load balancer

Which of the following are the features of AMPQ?

(A) Supports existing messaging brokers

(B) Runs the applications on different operating systems

(C) Provides rigid protocol

(D) Supports only one language and framework

(E) Provides rigid protocol
What is the importance of Push Notifications?

answer.text: Sends notifications to devices on different platforms
Increases the maintenance costs of an app

questiontext.text:
Which of the following communication models does Service Bus Queues work on?


(A) Publish messaging
(B) One-to-many form
(C) Subscribe messaging
(D) FIFO
(E) Brokered messaging

Which of the following are the features of SQL Database?


(A) Enables copies of data to be spread across multiple nodes in a datacenter or multiple datacenters.
(B) Requires no purchase for additional hardware or software except an account purchase.
(C) Requires installation of additional hardware or software on the premises.
(D) Maintains a single copy of the database on the cloud.
(E) Supports high availability, fault tolerance, and scaling. All these features are automatically available with the deployment.

Which of the following is an integrated environment that can be used for managing local and cloud
databases?
When can a developer perform query operations on an SQL Database instance?

answer.text: After the connection to the SQL Database is established.
After the connection to the SQL Database is terminated.
After the connection with the ADO.NET entity model is established.
Immediately after the Windows Azure account is created.
Immediately after the SQL Database account is created.

questiontext.text: What does a developer need in order to create a database instance of SQL Database?

answer.text: A secure source code of database on the http://azure.microsoft.com portal.

questiontext.text:
Which of the following are layers of SQL Database?

(A) Infrastructure layer

(B) Network layer

(C) Client layer

(D) Services layer

(E) Platform layer

Which of the following statements of SQL Database server are true?

(A) An SQL Database server can be situated in local datacenters of an organization or hosted in the cloud.

(B) An SQL Database server connects both the Client layer and the Platform layer.

(C) An SQL Database server, which is located in a specific geographical location, can run a number of SQL Databases.

(D) The SQL Database server also acts as a single entry point for the databases that are hosted on it.

(E) The SQL Database server requires partitioning when data is more than 150 GB per a single unit of co-located data sets.
Which of the following statements about SQL Database and Windows Azure Table Storage are true

answer.text: Windows Azure Table Storage is a relational database service, whereas, SQL Database is NoSQL key-value store, which is fault tolerant.
Windows Azure Table Storage consists of a randomly generated server name with the standard URL, which is .database.windows.net.
SQL Database is a relational database service and Windows Azure Table Storage is NoSQL key-value store, which is fault tolerant.
Windows Azure Table Storage connect with the virtual machine on your local system.
SQL Database displays an error when something is not done correctly or a restriction is being applied.

questiontext.text:
Which of the following are correct utilities provided by the local instance of SQL Server?

(A) SQL Server and Database

(B) Database Tuning Adviser (DTA)

(C) Server Database Analyzer

(D) SQL Server Profiler

(E) Network Administrator

Which of following are key activities of Application Lifecycle Management (ALM)?

(A) Software maintenance

(B) Release management

(C) Mechanical design

(D) Recycle process

(E) Software testing

Which are the three important aspects of ALM?

(A) Development

(B) Redesign

(C) Governance

(D) Management

(E) Operations
Which is the most popular tool to manage ALM process?

Which two methods are used commonly by a developer to track the progress of an application/activities during lifecycle management?

(A) Through application board

(B) Through formal board

(C) Through task bar

(D) Through Kanban board

(E) Through task board

Which of the following tasks can a developer perform using TFBuild?

(A) Define the build process

(B) Discuss the build

(C) Test the build

(D) Host the builds

(E) Diagnose the issues in the build

Which of the following are uses of XCopy?

(A) Deploying a Microsoft ASP.NET Web Application

(B) Test Azure deployment

(C) File transfer feature helps in simplifying the maintenance

(D) Enhance Website

(E) Software testing

Which are the two types of cloud environments?

(A) Staging

(B) Implementation

(C) Correction

(D) Production

(E) Reporting
Which tool stores a cache of packages that have been downloaded earlier for avoiding making unnecessary downloads?

Which of the following describe the task of the service configuration file?

(A) Specify the number of role instances for deploying the values

(B) Specify name

(C) Specify role in the service

(D) Specify type of file

(E) Specify thumbprints for all certificates

Which of the following key activities are allowed by Git for each developer?

(A) Obtain a copy of the local source repository

(B) Test Azure

(C) Work without connectivity

(D) Delete database connections

(E) Perform software testing
What causes the error “Difficulty in accessing '[siteURL]': Failed to connect to [scmAddress]”?

answer.text: Git does not support the Web site

questiontext.text:
Which of the following are basic requirements for linking Visual Studio Online to Windows Azure?

(A) Pay-as-you-go subscription

(B) Gmail Account

(C) MSDN subscription

(D) Microsoft Account

Identify the tasks involved in performing diagnostics for Azure hosts and Azure applications.

(A) Collecting diagnostic data

(B) Removing obsolete data

(C) Generating data for uploading

(D) Performing analysis of the data

(E) Diagnose the issues in the data

You need to recommend a data access technology to the contractor to retrieve data from the new data source.


Which data access technology should you recommend?
